com.poesys.db.dao.query

Class QueryMemcachedListWithParameters<T extends IDbDto,S extends IDbDto,C extends java.util.Collection<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dao.query.QueryListWithParameters<T,S,C>
      • com.poesys.db.dao.query.QueryMemcachedListWithParameters<T,S,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of IDbDto to query and cache
    S - the type of IDbDto that contains parameters
    C - the collection type of the set of queried DTOs
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQueryListWithParameters<T,S,C>

    public class QueryMemcachedListWithParameters<T extends IDbDto,S extends IDbDto,C extends java.util.Collection<T>>
extends QueryListWithParameters<T,S,C>
    An implementation of the IQueryListWithParameters interface that implements the basic elements of a query of multiple objects including caching. The query method executes the query and retrieves the results, but it first gets the primary key and looks up the object in the cache and uses any object that already exists rather than creating a new one.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryMemcachedListWithParameters

        public QueryMemcachedListWithParameters(IParameterizedQuerySql<T,S> sql,
                                        java.lang.String subsystem,
                                        java.lang.Integer expiration,
                                        int rows)
        Create a QueryCacheList object with the appropriate SQL class, the name of the subsystem that contains T, the memcached expiration time for objects of type T in the cache, and the number of rows to fetch at once.
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement specification
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem containing the T class
        expiration - the memcached expiration time in milliseconds for T objects
        rows - the number of rows to fetch at once; optimizes query fetching
